title: Why wasn't Demolish used for an Ohmwrecker rework instead of being a rune?
body:
Instead of the very niche "disable turret for 3 seconds" thing, they could've given it Demolish's effect. Could probably even lower the CD on it since you have to itemize for it and Ohmwrecker doesn't give any offensive capability.

Also, the idea of letting Ohmwrecker actually wreck turrets instead of just shutting them off for 3 seconds is nice. Mostly because Ohmwrecker's a tank item, and tanks can already tank more turret shots than Ohmwrecker negates anyway...

So the options in the Resolve tree became even shittier? Amazing.

We're looking at the runes system as a very iterative feature for League. We plan on improving it and iterating on it to make it better with time. Resolve being one of the main trees which could use some work to create more appealing choices.

>Resolve being one of the main trees which could use some work to create more appealing choices.

That's the understatement of the century. There's two good lesser runes in the entire tree, Conditioning and Overgrowth. These are the only two runes you ever actually want. 

I don't think Mirror Shell, Revitalise or Iron Skin are ever the correct choices on anyone bar Galio who has a niche rune all to himself and Second Wind is a rune you're sometimes forced into VS things like Panth but you feel shit about. Revitalise is honestly the worst trap in the game, it looks like it should be good on Soraka or something but the numbers are so bad it's actually better to just ignore it on everyone.

Then there's the first tier, which is completely abysmal. You chose the least crap of three garbage runes for your champ. All of them are too niche and honestly just bad.

Resolve doesn't just need some work, it needs a complete overhaul to the majority of the runes in the tree.

Revitalize is core on Mordekaiser, and arguably a good fit for a lot of people like Fiora, Aatrox, Nasus, Olaf, etc.

Second Wind is a super strong Rune to splash. It's basically written "you can't lose lane" on this Rune...

I agree that Mirror Shell/Iron Skin are super underwhelming, though.

Revitalise has two problems, it doesn't do anything when the target being healed is at 40%+, 5% bonus healing is a joke and it fails to be a usable rune on many tanks severely restricting the pool of usable runes.

Second Wind is an entirely reactive rune, you only take it into lanes where you need it, so the level of actual choice and customisation on this tier is pretty much null.

So well, I'm a bit late to the party, but this is still relevant.

> it doesn't do anything when the target being healed is at 40%+, 5% bonus healing is a joke 

5% healing is nowhere near a joke. If a Rune was giving 5% increased damage without condition, it would be a must-pick, and none of the damage amplifying Runes EVER reach 15%, not even when the conditions are much more difficult to meet than 40% HP. Last Stand is only 12% under 30% HP, so a smaller bonus with a harsher condition, and it's the biggest increase available.
Of course, the parallel isn't perfect, everyone has (at least some) damage, but not everyone has heals and shields, but that's why Revitalize values are also higher. Saying it's a joke is just ridiculous.

>  it fails to be a usable rune on many tanks severely restricting the pool of usable runes.

Even Tanks without heal or shield at all still have an interesting and generic option on that line: Overgrowth, so there is no dead Rune, and that's enough. It's important to have SOME interesting choices among your 6 Runes, but not EVERY choice should be equally interesting. It's just as if you were complaining about long range poke champ always picking Comet and painting that as a lack of customization. No it's not. It's good to have some Runes that are clear fits and clearly superior choices, as long as there is some customization elsewhere.
Not to mention that someone like Braum, for instance, should definitely pick Revitalize because it also works on heals/shields from items, even though he has no heal/shield of his own.

> Second Wind is an entirely reactive rune, you only take it into lanes where you need it, so the level of actual choice and customisation on this tier is pretty much null.

That's just nonsense... "I can pick a different Rune depending on my match-up so I have no customization possible" isn't even remotely logical. And this isn't even taking into account that the situation is far from binary  ---either you need Second Wind or not. So in some relatively hard match-ups, but not the hardest of all, where Second Wind would be nice to have but not absolutely necessary, you really have a choice: opting for an easy lane versus betting on the late game with Overgrowth.

>5% healing is nowhere near a joke. If a Rune was giving 5% increased damage without condition, it would be a must-pick, and none of the damage amplifying Runes EVER reach 15%, not even when the conditions are much more difficult to meet than 40% HP. Last Stand is only 12% under 30% HP, so a smaller bonus with a harsher condition, and it's the biggest increase available.

5% healing is a complete joke, every single champion in the game sans maybe Soraka deals more damage than they do healing. Take a look at the actual numbers for a second, let's look at Sona, her heal on W is 110+(25%AP), so this rune gives an increase of 5.5+(1.25%AP). That really is pathetic, the flat increase is only 22 AP worth of healing at max level and 22 AP is far better than this rune since it also gives you damage elsewhere.

If you just look at the flat numbers and how pathetic they are quite easily.

>Even Tanks without heal or shield at all still have an interesting and generic option on that line: Overgrowth, so there is no dead Rune, and that's enough. It's important to have SOME interesting choices among your 6 Runes, but not EVERY choice should be equally interesting. It's just as if you were complaining about long range poke champ always picking Comet and painting that as a lack of customization. No it's not. It's good to have some Runes that are clear fits and clearly superior choices, as long as there is some customization elsewhere.

I main Sejuani jungle, please tell me what my choices in this failure of a tree are.
On the first tier the only decent option is Perseverance, which is still terrible. On the second tier the only rune worth taking is Conditioning. On the third tier the only usable rune is Overgrowth and as a Keystone my only option is Aftershock. There's no actual options in the tree, infact the best thing you can do is to ignore Resolve and run Precision and Domination with Fleet Footwork because the Resolve tree is completely pathetic.

>Not to mention that someone like Braum, for instance, should definitely pick Revitalize because it also works on heals/shields from items, even though he has no heal/shield of his own.

Nobody does this, try again. It's his least used rune on this slot by a significant margin.

http://champion.gg/statistics/#?sortBy=general.totalHeal&order=descend

Zac, Vladimir, Aatrox, Warwick, Fiddlestick, Sion (and he even has a shield on top of that that isn't counted in the stats), Maokai, Tryndamere, Nunu, Gragas, Nami. But that's totally normal for a squishy mage support).

As far as I understand it, Revitalise strengthens your heals/shields even if used on allies, making it a choice for Soraka, Nami, Sona, Karma etc.

Font of Life triggers off of lots of support abilities too, so it makes it easy to spread heals and trigger Ardent Censer.

I do agree if you're a tank, the tree feels rather lacking. Tenacity is nice, but Precision gives Tenacity too, alongside damage amp and a heal on takedowns; useful for a tank in a teamfight.

The middle runes are hard to appreciate, the lower runes are actually pretty good.

>As far as I understand it, Revitalise strengthens your heals/shields even if used on allies, making it a choice for Soraka, Nami, Sona, Karma etc.

Unless your target is <40% the rune doesn't do anything. These champs get no other real bonuses from a Resolve spec since Font honestly just isn't that good. All of these champs would prefer either Sorcery/Dom or Sorcery/Insight over Sorcery/Resolve.

>I do agree if you're a tank, the tree feels rather lacking. Tenacity is nice, but Precision gives Tenacity too, alongside damage amp and a heal on takedowns; useful for a tank in a teamfight.

Tenacity is actually a very weak stat for tanks, they take it especially out of the jungle but only because the other options are so poor. Tenacity is a stronger stat for bruisers who need to constantly AA rather than tanks who tend to have high impact spells.

>The middle runes are hard to appreciate, the lower runes are actually pretty good.

The lower runes aren't the worst ever but they force you into a path almost every game. You're a jungle tank, your only option is Overgrowth. You're in a farm lane, Overgrowth. VS Jayce, Second Wind. There's really no actual choice here.

A 5% increase, do you understand what that means? If you heal for 200, you now heal for 210. That's really doing nothing. You'd actually get more healing/second by specing Insperation and taking 5% CDR.

More appealing choices are desperately needed in that third line with Iron Skin, Mirror Shell, and Conditioning. There is absolutely no reason whatsoever to pick Mirror Shell or Iron Skin, because what they offer is INCREDIBLY niche and those who can trigger it without a Soraka or Nami are limited.

> [{quoted}](name=Maple Nectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oVpTVTv1,comment-id=000500010000,timestamp=2017-11-30T18:07:41.318+0000)
>
> It overrode it, so if you planned on buying Ohmwrecker you could opt into a different rune.

Huh. That actually surprises me, as one of the interesting things about itemization is, in my mind, that it's often reactive to the game's needs. The fact that you plan your rune choice ahead of time for a purchase that may end up being a bad choice with how the game develops feels off to me.

Unless, of course, you pivoted Demolisher onto the item and kept it off runes, that that also feels bad, as it's a really cool thing to snag on a bunch of characters and feels really satisfying.

If you revisit it, I'd be interested in trying tying the cooldowns together such that purchasing Ohmwrecker when you have Demolisher reduces the cooldown significantly, so that you can get 2 hits off if you're able to stick on a tower for 10-15 seconds (i.e. cooldown reduced by Y seconds for each additional tower hit if you have Demolish). That might preserve the feeling that having both is viable without limiting your itemization/pre-game choice, or letting you just burst down towers at a touch.
For the sake of seeing "how bad can it get" did you test it stacking?

I think it would be cooler it replaced it and you gave us another rune for the resolved tree. I see a lot of champions currently taking it in which it seems odd or out of place (mainly because the rune doesn't synergize with whatever they are doing, like having it on a leona or bltizcrank.

As a side note I also really dislike the runes that give you armor or mr when you are healing, and think they should be changed for more fun runes that don't depend on knowing before hand who you are playing against (I play blind pick a lot)

how about try  something more simple and give the item decent stats. top defensive items are garbage but you can afford to make more garbage defensive items, and why gut Knights Vow's stats because Marksmen were becoming too tanky? You gut the wrong side of the item. Why is the response to marksmen being too tanky 'Okay marksmen are too tanky lets gut the tanks defense'
How about [this](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/B3bbOwPn-what-if-ohmwrecker-could-disable-enemy-towers-or-buff-allied-towers)? : )

simply adjusting it would likely be sufficient, instead of removing the deactivate turret for 3 seconds, you could likely combine the effect to make ohmwrecker more effective, example: after a delay (the time it takes to fully charge the demolish ability) your next basic attack against the turret deals increased damage (with the same modifications as Demolish) and disables the turret for 3-5 seconds based on level (with 5 seconds starting at level 16)
because turrets are trash so it doesnt matter lol

I think it would be pretty awesome if they added an item similar to Ohmwrecker's effect for assassins that was basically a small amount of stats, maybe some ad and then had the effect, "towers will not target you for 2s upon activation". Allowing an assassin to dive effectively, at the cost of say the lethality or magic shield you'd get from a different item to try to make plays. And the activation would only work for that champion so a gank would still be risky for multiple people.

Riot needs to look at items and see what items are NOT being used at all (even very little) and figure out why. Why would a item they made never be used? Why is it still a "bad" item. I want to be the cool guy in the game that uses ohm wrecker in a game, but there is no spots for it in a optimal build.

Who is in charge there? Get ur ducks in a row...
